folder: Northern Boulevard & Douglaston Parkway, Queens, NY
text:
Northern Boulevard, north side, between Douglaston Parkway (left), and 244th Street (right) showing the Zion Church (P.E.) of Douglaston. This church was donated by Wynant Van Zandt Jr. He also gave the pipe organ and other furniture. The church was constructed on July 30, 1830. Bishop Hobart was the rector. Wm. P. Douglas donated the Chancel. The Parish Hall was largely built by a gift of Bloodgood Cutter, the Long Island farmer poet. This edifice was damaged by fire on December 24, 1924. The new edifice was opened about January 1st, 1926.
June 1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

folder: Northern Boulevard & Douglaston Parkway, Queens, NY
text:
Northern Boulevard, north side, between Douglaston Parkway (left) and 244th Street (right), showing the Protestant Episcopal Zion Church of Douglaston. For a complete history see other views. This is a set of three views taken at the same time but from different angles.
June 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

folder: Northern Boulevard & Douglaston Parkway, Queens, NY
text:
Northern Boulevard, at Douglaston, showing the marshes.  In the foreground is a pool with a row boat.

P. L. Sperr     April 12, 1927

folder: Northern Boulevard & Douglaston Parkway, Queens, NY
text:
Northern Boulevard, north side, between Douglaston Parkway and 244th Street, showing the Zion Protestant Episcopal Church, restored after the fire of 1925. The edifice was erected in 1830 and was known, in 1873, as the Little Neck Church.

F. L. Sperr
April 12, 1927
Views 1,2
